protocol.text: Arabidopsis was grown on metro mix soil (35 % Canadian Peat Moss, 19 % Perlite 500, 40 % vermiculite, 1.5 g l-1 lime), vernalised for 72 to 96 h and fertilized with 0.5X Hoagland’s once a fortnight (Hoaglands and Arnon, 1950). Normal growth conditions were a light (150 μmol photons m−2 sec−1)/dark cycle of 12/12 h at 21 + 2 °C and 55 % relative humidity.

Total RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Plant Mini Protocol (QIAGEN) including an on-column DNase treatment using the RNase-free DNase set (QIAGEN) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the RNA was verified using an Agilent Bioanalyzer and spectrophotometric analysis to determine concentration and the A260 to A280 and A260 to A230 ratios.
Scanning was performed with a Affymetrix 7G scanner according to the manufacturers instructions.

Preparation of labeled cRNA from 5 ug of total RNA was carried out almost exactly as described in the Affymetrix GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual using the Affymetrix One-Cycle Target Labeling kit and Control Reagents and for each sample, 20ug of cRNA was fragmented, labeled and used for hybridisation.

Target hybridisation was carried out exactly as described in the Affymetrix GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual, using the Affymetrix Eukaryotic Hybridisation kit and Hybridisation Control Kit and an Affymetrix GeneChip Hybridization Oven 640. After overnight hybridisation, arrays were washed and stained using the Affymetrix Wash and Stain kit and an Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450 (EukGE-WS2v5_450) as described in the Affymetrix GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual.
